conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions team—I'm Student_C. School_D is my first-choice school, and I’m very excited about the chance to join. I’m ready to commit if accepted and would be grateful for your consideration this round.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. Although School_D prioritizes Student_D and Student_E above me, applying immediately gives me the only chance to be considered before the seat is taken. I will clearly signal strong commitment and fit to maximize acceptance chances in case higher-priority students do not apply or apply elsewhere.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your thoughtful application and for naming School_D as your first choice. After reviewing applications this round and given our limited seats, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_D and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority is D > E > C > B > A with quota 1. In this round I received APPLY from Student_C and Student_E. Student_E is ranked higher than Student_C on my list, so accepting Student_C now would block a better available option. Also, Student_E ranks School_D 4th, so there is some risk they may later prefer other schools, but they are applying now and I can accept them instead. Therefore I should reject Student_C to preserve the seat for the higher-priority applicant.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions, I’m Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_D and would be excited to contribute to the school community. If offered a seat, I’m ready to accept and enroll. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but I am low priority there (4th) and several students rank it highly (A and D have it as #1; I have it as #1). With capacity 1, applying immediately is likely to be rejected if higher-priority applicants apply. To maximize my eventual outcome, I should target a school where I have a strong priority position and that is still high on my list. At School_D, I am 2nd in priority (behind only Student_D), and School_D is still on my acceptable list. Applying now gives me a strong chance to secure a match before competition escalates.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your application and your interest in School_D. We are pleased to offer you admission—if you are ready to commit as stated, we will reserve our seat for you. Welcome to School_D. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority order is D > E > C > B > A. In this round I have applications from Student_C and Student_E. Student_E is ranked higher than Student_C on my list, and I have quota 1. Student_D (my top choice) has not applied to me; given Student_D’s preferences (School_C first, School_A second, School_B third, School_E fourth, School_D last), it is unlikely they will come to me unless rejected elsewhere, so waiting is risky. Student_E ranks School_D 4th, but they are applying now and state they will enroll if accepted, so accepting secures a high-priority student immediately and prevents ending up with a lower-priority match or an unfilled seat.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee—I'm Student_B and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because your programs and environment are the best fit for my goals, and if accepted I will commit to enrolling. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your thoughtful application and for sharing that School_A is your first choice. conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions—I'm Student_D. School_C is my first choice because I’m looking for a rigorous environment and I believe I’d contribute positively to the community. I’m very interested in enrolling if offered a seat. [APPLY]

Student_D has us as first choice, so they may reapply later if unmatched, but we still prefer to keep the seat available for higher-priority candidates.
